rComments: Entire course was centered on making autonomous machine from scratch in group of 3, so it's mainly just working with your group & figuring things on your own. He will be helpful if you ask for help outside of class. Overall getting a good mark is hit or miss-depends on your TA. Prof Emami is a nice guy but old fashion so some ppl dont like him.

This prof is probably one of the best in the university. He takes time to clearly explain all the concepts and grades you on them quite fairly. Lots of examples, applications, practise questions. Really makes you gravitate towards the field of Robotics.
totally agree with the last remarks.

I decided to write in here just because of a couple of unfair comments about the prof. I took aer201 this past winter and honestly all I saw from emami was care and devotion. He does his job very well and I owe him a lot. But I think I know why a few engscis are so mad at him. Some folks are used to be treated especially and emami doesn't budge.
one of the best profs i saw in 4 years.

I took his course a while a go, and now that I look back, I can't help think that he was probably one of the best profs I had in my undergrad. The course was hard, yeah, but I learned way more in his course than I did in any of my other courses. He's super intelligent, and a bit intimidating, but he's actually such a nice guy.
no

Fundamentally useless and gives virtually no support. Ridiculous we have to pay for a course where we essentially are told to do a project by ourselves.   Also republishes textbook year to year and only includes essential info on there to wring more money out of students.
This guy is awful. He is disrespectful and cocky and does not know how to talk to people

I made it through last year with Emami's help. He's good really. I heard he doesn't teach the course this year, and people are now using arduino toys for the design projects. That sounds too convenient to me. Anyhow, good luck to all. This course is enjoyable if you have a good coach.
I made my mind to work in robotics business thanks to the course I took this past fall. Emami is a very good teacher and he knows a lot of stuff. His course was one of the best I took at U Toronto.

He is a good lecturer, and the course is well organized. However, he won't admit he doesn't know about some pretty important details that you will come across in your project. So make sure to double check things he tells you in person.

I came across this site and thought to pay my dues to a prof who really left a mark in my studies. I took his robotics course a couple of years ago and though it was pretty late in my education (last year) it really showed me what a good teacher means. Without this course I could barely appreciate the value of my education. Way to go, prof Emami!
I did it and I loved it.
So far, the course has been very impressive. I can see why students are so fond of the prof. He seems to know how to keep students interested in his course.
good stuff

I myself like lecture courses better. I can perform better when Im on my own. Happened exactly like that...my individual evaluations were all good but I teamed up with two other people who didn't care as much and that pulled my mark down below average. But in all fairness, emami did whatever he could to help us out. The course IS unique.
This course really is one of a kind. Hats off to professor Emami!

I was passing this site and thought to express my thanks to this prof. He taught the robotics course really well. He has a unique way of explaining theoretical stuff which makes sense. This was one of my best experiences in four years of my study.
This guy rocks...never had such a caring teacher before. Just bring in more of this type to uoft then you'll see how kids love school.
nice prof
My learning in this course is phenomenal. Takes too much time though but its worth every minute. The prof is super helpful...textbook is very good too.
This man defines "genius". Enough said.
One of my best courses. I worked alot and learned alot. Good prof.
I'm taking his robotics course this year...awesome. Love the course organization.
Clearly one of the better teachers at U of T. So knowledgeable, incredibly organized, clear and concise. The best course notes I've seen yet! He also seems super nice and considerate.
the boss! knows everything about everything. very helpful and very professional. looks like a true boss.
actually i've started enjoying the course.
Prof. Emami is a very nice and caring person. Such a tough course needs someone like him. Course notes are very helpful,too. Appreciate it...
busy busy with the proposal...
Nice prof...good course...hey that's me, love building stuff...
seems engsci can finally offer a course which makes "sense"...really
design is tough though
i agree...good start...the course is tough though.
wow...that was an impressive start.
cool
good

Don't take everything the man says at face value... he strongly reccommended that programmers use assembly due to efficiency- bottom line is people did it with ease in C.  Ask questions.  Ask questions.  Make no assumptions.  Ask questions.  And pick a SOLID team.  Don't compromise on your team selection!
Very good in class (clear, concise, helpful). Mean and stuck up outside off class (rude, sees the world in black and white)
He's amazing at what he does. Don't know any other class where I've learned so much. He actually knows what he's doing and its interesting to see how much he loves what he does.
tries really hard...
great!
Good course. Definitely different than other courses. I learned a lot for my real life.
love this course...
tough course, lovely prof.
Way to go...I'm not scared of Design any more.
fantastic!
nice lectures!
Definitely knows a lot of stuff. Nice lectures. Wish we had more of this hand this year.
I like the way he teaches too.
Good Teacher
Spends a lot of time with the students. A dedicated prof. Knows a lot. Teaches well.

Extremely helpful with design, great guy to talk to in general.  Always has lots of great, new ideas, most popular course in second year.  Needs to make lectures more useful though.  His textbook's awesome, especially for circuit people.
Very nice guy. Always helpful, always tries hard. Needs to work on the lecture comPOWnent of his class.
